page.title: 09 HIGHCLIFFE FETE
page.content: The{3rd Highcliffe Fete}was organised by{Highcliffe Community {Association}on Saturday May 25th 1985 at 1:30 p.m. on the cliff top in Wharncliffe Road. Over a thousand people attended. The 25 stalls included lottery, bric-a-brac, books, games and painting, raising over Â£700 for{Greystones Building Fund,}the home of the Association .The lottery raised most, the prize was a Ford Fiesta car. Ted Parham (Chairman) and Leslie Boyland (President) were the judges of the children's fancy dress. The pet show was in 7 classes and the prizes were rosettes. Children's races were popular. Maypole dancing by the drama group was popular too. There were displays by the{Dolphins Motorcycle {Team, The Burgundy Majorettes}and the {Christchurch Marching Youth Band. By Victoria Coubro.
